Linux_Mounts_mount_Options.TableManual: What is currently mounted and what are the mountoptions

Linux_NFSd_server_remote_procedure_calls.TableManual: The statistics gatherd about rpc when acting as a server.

Linux_NFS_Mounts_nfsiostat.TableManual: One row per NFS share mounted

Linux_Disk_Capacity_mount_capacity.TableManual:
How much room is available on the different mounts. 
If the amount sizes of the filesystems dont add up to the available diskspace, NOTE that if you use a partition as swap, the mount will not show up here

Linux_CPU_Usage_cpu_usage.TableManual:
The utilisation of the different cores and the cpu overall in the system.
Default thresholds are set at iowait and %busy. High iowait means the cpu is waiting for io. This could indicate a problem with storage or the network

Linux_Process_Inventory_process_inventor.TableManual: All processes and the resources they use

Linux_Disk_Capacity_disk_capacity.TableManual: How large are the different storage media's

SSH_systemctl.CommandLine: systemctl list-units --type service | sed '/^$/Q' | iconv -c -f utf-8 -t ascii | tail -n +2

SSH_sar.CommandLine: sar -n DEV  1 1 | tac | sed '/^$/Q' | tac | awk '{$1=""}1'

SSH_mpstat.CommandLine: mpstat -P ALL 1 1 | grep -v all | tac | sed '/^$/Q' | tac

SSH_systemctl_systemctl.CommandLine: systemctl list-units --type service | sed '/^$/Q' | iconv -c -f utf-8 -t ascii | tail -n +2

SSH_mpstat_mpstat.CommandLine: mpstat -P ALL 1 1 | grep -v all | tac | sed '/^$/Q' | tac

SSH_sar_sar.CommandLine: sar -n DEV  1 1 | tac | sed '/^$/Q' | tac | awk '{$1=""}1'

Linux_CPU_Load_load_avg_lscpu_number_of_.AlarmTextInfoParams: amount of cores in the system

Linux_Process_Inventory_process_inventor.AlarmTextInfoParams: how long the process has been active

Linux_CPU_Usage_cpu_usage_overall_mpstat.AlarmTextInfoParams: % of the CPU used waiting for io

Linux_NFSd_server_remote_procedure_calls.AlarmTextInfoParams: number of completed rpc calls preformed as server

Linux_Disk_Utilisation_disk_ioops_iostat.AlarmTextInfoParams: bandwidth of the disk being used
How long does it take forthe disk to obtain the data afer it left the queue

Linux_CPU_Usage_cpu_usage_mpstat_25irq.AlarmTextInfoParams: % of the core used for hardware interrupts

Linux_CPU_Load_load_avg_sar_avg_5.AlarmTextInfoParams: The load average of the past 5 minuts

Linux_Memory_Usage_memory_usage_free_typ.AlarmTextInfoParams: type of memory. This is either RAM or SWAP

Linux_CPU_Load_load_avg_sar_avg_1.AlarmTextInfoParams: The load average of the past minut

Linux_NFS_Mounts_nfsiostat_nfsiostat_w_a.AlarmTextInfoParams: time elapsed between sending a write request and recieving an awnser

Linux_CPU_Load_load_avg_sar_avg_15.AlarmTextInfoParams: The load average of the past 15 minuts

Linux_Process_Inventory_process_inventor.AlarmTextInfoParams: command used to call the process

Linux_CPU_Usage_cpu_usage_mpstat_25sys.AlarmTextInfoParams: % of the core used by kernel processes

Linux_Disk_Capacity_mount_capacity_df_us.AlarmTextInfoParams: how much data is already on the mount, relative to the size of the mount

Linux_CPU_Usage_cpu_usage_mpstat_25iowai.AlarmTextInfoParams: % of the core used waiting for io

Linux_CPU_Usage_cpu_usage_overall_mpstat.AlarmTextInfoParams: % of the CPU used by kernel processes

Linux_Services_systemctl_systemctl_activ.AlarmTextInfoParams: Is the service active or not

Linux_CPU_Usage_cpu_usage_overall_mpstat.AlarmTextInfoParams: % of the CPU used for hardware interrupts
% of the CPU used for software interrputs

Linux_NFS_Mounts_nfsiostat_nfsiostat_avg.AlarmTextInfoParams: time elapsed between sending a read request and recieving an awnser

Linux_CPU_Usage_cpu_usage_mpstat_25idle.AlarmTextInfoParams: % of the core that it is idle

Linux_Uptime_uptime_uptime_number_of_day.AlarmTextInfoParams: The number of days the system is running

Linux_Services_service_service_status.AlarmTextInfoParams: State of the service, unknown means this service has no status command

Linux_CPU_Usage_cpu_usage_overall_mpstat.AlarmTextInfoParams: % of the CPU used by user processes

Linux_CPU_Load_load_avg_sar_run_queue_si.AlarmTextInfoParams: The size of the CPU queue. How many tasks are waiting for CPU-time

Linux_Memory_Usage_memory_usage_free_tot.AlarmTextInfoParams: total amount of memory in the system

Linux_NFS_Mounts_nfsiostat_nfsiostat_op_.AlarmTextInfoParams: operations send to the share per second

Linux_CPU_Usage_cpu_usage_mpstat_25usr.AlarmTextInfoParams: % of the core used by user processes

Linux_NFSd_server_remote_procedure_calls.AlarmTextInfoParams: number of uncompleted rpc calls preformed as server, The threshold is relative to the amount of calls preformed

Linux_CPU_Usage_cpu_usage_overall_mpstat.AlarmTextInfoParams: % of the CPU that it is idle

Linux_Disk_Capacity_mount_capacity_df_us.AlarmTextInfoParams: how much data is already on the mount

Linux_Disk_Capacity_disk_capacity_lsblk_.AlarmTextInfoParams: whether the device is read only

Linux_NFS_Mounts_nfsiostat_nfsiostat_kB_.AlarmTextInfoParams: total kB/s send to the share

Linux_CPU_Usage_cpu_usage_mpstat_25soft.AlarmTextInfoParams: % of the core used for software interrputs

Linux_Disk_Capacity_mount_capacity_df_av.AlarmTextInfoParams: of much data is available on the mount

Linux_Process_Inventory_process_inventor.AlarmTextInfoParams: % of cpu used by the process
% of memory used by the process

Linux_NTP_ntpd_ntpdc_offset.AlarmTextInfoParams: how far out of sync is the host to the server

Linux_NTP_ntpd_ntpdc_delay.AlarmTextInfoParams: time required to reach ntp server

Linux_NFSd_server_remote_procedure_calls.AlarmTextInfoParams: number of uncompleted rpc calls due to failed authentication preformed as server

Linux_CPU_Usage_cpu_usage_mpstat_25busy.AlarmTextInfoParams: % of the core that it is busy

Linux_CPU_Usage_cpu_usage_overall_mpstat.AlarmTextInfoParams: % of the CPU that it is idle
